org.spongepowered.api.text.selector

Interface SelectorFactory


  • public interface SelectorFactory
    Internal implementation factory: Use the methods in Selector, Argument and ArgumentTypes instead.

    • Method Summary

      Fetch completions for a selector command argument.

      • createBuilder

        Selector.Builder createBuilder()
        Creates a Selector.Builder.
        Returns:
        A new selector builder with the specified type

      • parseRawSelector

        Selector parseRawSelector(String selector)
        Parses a Selector from the given selector string.
        Parameters:
        selector - The raw selector string
        Returns:
        A new selector containing the given selector data

      • createScoreArgumentType

        ArgumentHolder.Limit<ArgumentType<Integer>> createScoreArgumentType(String name)
        Creates a minimum and maximum ArgumentType filtering depending on the score of the specified objective.
        Parameters:
        name - The objective name to use
        Returns:
        The created argument type

      • getArgumentType

        Optional<ArgumentType<?>> getArgumentType(String name)
        Gets the ArgumentType with the provided name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the argument type
        Returns:
        The ArgumentType with the given name or Optional.empty() if not found

      • getArgumentTypes

        Collection<ArgumentType<?>> getArgumentTypes()
        Gets a Collection of all possible ArgumentTypes.
        Returns:
        The list of all available ArgumentTypes

      • createArgumentType

        ArgumentType<String> createArgumentType(String key)
        Creates a custom ArgumentType with the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for the argument
        Returns:
        The created argument type

      • createArgumentType

        <T> ArgumentType<T> createArgumentType(String key,
                                       Class<T> type)
        Creates a custom ArgumentType with the specified key and value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The argument's value type
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for the argument
        type - The class of the argument's value type
        Returns:
        The created argument type

      • createArgument

        <T> Argument<T> createArgument(ArgumentType<T> type,
                               T value)
        Creates a new Argument using the specified type and value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the argument value
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the argument
        value - The value of the argument
        Returns:
        The created argument

      • createArgument

        <T> Argument.Invertible<T> createArgument(ArgumentType.Invertible<T> type,
                                          T value,
                                          boolean inverted)
        Creates a new Argument.Invertible using the specified type and value. The created Argument will be inverted based on the given parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the argument value
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the invertible argument
        value - The value of the invertible argument
        inverted - true if the argument should be inverted
        Returns:
        The created invertible argument

      • createArguments

        <T,V> Set<Argument<T>> createArguments(ArgumentHolder<? extends ArgumentType<T>> type,
                                       V value)
        Creates a new set of Arguments using the specified type and value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the arguments' joined value
        V - The type of the arguments' sub-values
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the arguments
        value - The value of the arguments
        Returns:
        The created argument

      • parseArgument

        Argument<?> parseArgument(String argument)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parses an Argument from the given argument string.

        In Vanilla, it should be formatted like key=value.

        Parameters:
        argument - The argument string
        Returns:
        The parsed argument
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the argument couldn't be parsed (e.g. due to invalid format)

      • complete

        List<String> complete(String selector)
        Fetch completions for a selector command argument.
        Parameters:
        selector - The partial selector
        Returns:
        Tab completions for the next part of the selector
